problem: If $7^{4x}=343$, what is the value of $7^{4x-3}$?
solution: $7^{4x-3}$ can be written as $7^{4x}\cdot 7^{-3}$. Since we know that $7^{4x}=343$, we have $7^{4x-3}=343\cdot 7^{-3}=343\cdot \frac{1}{343}=\boxed{1}$.
chatgpt_solution:
We can also find the value of $7^{4x - 3}$ by taking $7^{4x}$, and then multiplying by $7^{-3}$.  This gives us  \[
7^{4x - 3}=7^{4x}\cdot 7^{-3}=\frac{7^{4x}}{7^3}.
\]Since $7^{4x} = 343$, we have  \[
\frac{7^{4x}}{7^3} = \frac{343}{7^3} = \frac{343}{343} \cdot \frac{1}{7^2} = \boxed{\frac{1}{49}}.
\]
